# for loop
random_walk1 <- function(n) {
  step <- 0
  for (i in 1:n) {
    firstinput <- sample(c(-1, 1), size = 1, prob = c(0.5, 0.5))
    if (firstinput == 1) {
      step <- step + (sample(c(1, 10), size = 1, prob = c(0.95, 0.05)))
    } else {
      step <- step + (sample(c(-1, -3), size = 1, prob = c(0.80, 0.20)))
    }
  }
  return(step)
}

# R vectorized functions
random_walk2 <- function(n) {
  steps <- sample(c(-1, 1), size = n, prob = c(0.5, 0.5), replace = TRUE)
  positives <- which(steps == 1)
  positivesteps <- sample(c(1, 10), size = length(positives), 
                          prob = c(0.95, 0.05), replace = TRUE)
  steps[positives] <- positivesteps
  
  negatives <- which(steps == -1)
  negativesteps <- sample(c(-1,-3), size = length(negatives), 
                          prob = c(0.80, 0.20), replace = TRUE)
  steps[negatives] <- negativesteps
  
  return(sum(steps))
}
